Legal_Issue: Whether the Respondent met the residency requirement under the Citizenship Act and whether the Citizenship Judge provided adequate reasons
Application_Facts: The Respondent was absent for 630 days, falling short of the 1095-day residency requirement within a four-year period
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; Citizenship Judge's decision overturned
Remedy_Requested: Overturning of the Citizenship Judge's approval of citizenship application
Court_Ruling: The appeal is allowed due to inadequate reasoning by the Citizenship Judge and failure to meet statutory residency requirements
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to meet the 1095-day physical presence requirement and provided insufficient evidence of residency
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient evidence of residency and unclear reasoning by the Citizenship Judge
Legal_Standard: Applicant must reside in Canada for at least 1095 days in a four-year period
Assessment_Factor: Duration of absence from Canada, adequacy of judicial reasoning
Procedural_Issue: Review of Citizenship Judge's decision for adequacy of reasons and compliance with legal standards
Evidence_Used: Record of absences totaling 630 days, citizenship application documents
Legal_Provision_Cited: Residency requirement under the Citizenship Act (1095 days in four years)
Application_Basis: Physical presence in Canada over a four-year period
Evidence_Assessed: Respondent’s travel records and residency documentation
Relief_Sought: Rejection of citizenship application based on non-compliance with residency rules
Governing_Rule: An applicant must be physically present in Canada for at least 1095 days within four years prior to application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Citizenship Judge failed to specify which residency test was applied or explain why the requirement was satisfied
Outcome: Appeal allowed; citizenship application denied due to non-compliance and inadequate reasons
Harm_Assessment: Risk of granting citizenship to individuals who do not meet法定 residency obligations
Cause_Description: Minister appealed the approval of the Respondent's citizenship application due to insufficient proof of residency and lack of clear justification by the judge
Evidence_Handling: Failure to properly assess or document evaluation of residency evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section of the Citizenship Act regarding physical presence requirement
Evidence_Issues: Vague reasoning, lack of specificity in assessing residency duration
Residency_Compliance: Not met – only 630 days present, 465 days short of required 1095
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate assessment by the Citizenship Judge
Decision_Rationale: The Judge did not provide sufficient reasoning to support the conclusion that residency requirements were met
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of clarity, specificity, and completeness in judicial reasoning regarding residency calculation
Legal_Standard_Applied: Statutory interpretation of residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
